text:
East River Drive (under construction) south from E. 25th Street, photographed from atop the J. J. Little and Ives Co. plant at No. 425-35 E. 24th Street.
The shore line is being extended above 23rd Street, where the existing Exterior Street begins. The Drive will incorporate the latter to 17th Street. There it will veer to the waters edge (over new ground) to skirt Willard Parker Hospital and the N. Y. Edison Co. plant. The chimneys of the last mentioned are on the right and appear above the darkened utilitarian structure, the City's Motor Transport Building.
Note the playground area being constructed in the foreground of View 1. This lies between 24th Street and 25th Street. The former recreation pier at the foot of 24th Street has been removed. Incidentally, this title is a misnomer, as the use for same was discontinued during the 1st World War. The U. S. Government took control for transport service and never relinquished it.
A future seaplane landing platform has been constructed at the foot of 23rd Street. The Greenpoint Ferry slips were formerly there.

P. L. Sperr

October 13, 1939
Views 1,2,3

October 13, 1939
Views 1,2,3

East River Drive (under construction) north from E. 25th Street, as photographed from atop the J. J. Little and Ives Co. Building at No. 425-35 E. 24th St. The shoreline is being extended to provide for same. The enclosed pier, (foot of 25th St.) an annex to the Municipal Lodging House will eventually be removed. The institutional structures are wings of Bellevue Hospital. Across the river is the Greenpoint--Long Island City shore and in the distance, the Queensboro Bridge can be discerned.

October 13, 1939
Views 1,2,3

P. L. Sperr
